subdivision_of_building: Part ground floor and mezzanine floor.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s):

LOCATION PLAN; 160750 A(SO)90 (EXISTING UPPER BASEMENT FLOOR PLAN); 160750 A(SO)100 (EXISTING GROUND FLOOR PLAN); 160750 A(SO)105 (EXISTING MEZZANINE FLOOR PLAN); 160750 A(SO)290 (EXISTING SITE PLAN); 160750 A(SO)300 (EXISTING SECTION AA); 160750 A(SO)310 (EXISTING SECTION BB); 160750 A(SO)320 (EXISTING SECTION CC); 160750 A(SO)340 (EXISTING SECTION EE); 160750 A(SO)401 (EXISTING EAST ELEVATION); 160750 A(SO)402 (EXISTING NORTH ELEVATION); 160750 A(SO)403 (EXISTING SOUTH ELEVATION); 160750 A(SO)404 (EXISTING WEST ELEVATION); 160750 A(GA)90 (PROPOSED UPPER BASEMENT FLOOR PLAN); 160750 A(GA)100 REV B (PROPOSED GROUND FLOOR PLAN); 160750 A(GA)105 REV A (PROPOSED MEZZANINE FLOOR PLAN); 160750 A(GA)290 (PROPOSED SITE PLAN); 160750 A(GA)300 REV A (PROPOSED SECTION); 160750 A(GA)310 REV A (PROPOSED SECTION BB); 160750 A(GA)320 (PROPOSED SECTION CC); 160750 A(GA)340 (PROPOSED SECTION EE); 160750 A(GA)401 REV A (PROPOSED EAST ELEVATION); 160750 A(GA)402 (PROPOSED NORTH ELEVATION); 160750 A(GA)403 REV A (PROPOSED SOUTH ELEVATION); 160750 A(GA)404 (PROPOSED WEST ELEVATION); DAYLIGHT AND SUNLIGHT REPORT WITHIN DEVELOPMENT 2 JANUARY 2024; DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT REV A APRIL 2024; FIRE STATEMENT FORM; (TS03) REV B TRANSPORT STATEMENT 21 DECEMBER 2023; ENERGY STATEMENT v.3 14 JUNE 2024; LANDSCAPE ADDENDUM JUNE 2024
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until cycle further parking facilities for 34 bicycles have been provided within the curtilage of the application site. Such facilities shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To encourage the use of sustainable transport, provide for adequate cycle parking facilities and to safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area, in accordance with Policies D4, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the measures in the updated energy statement (ENERGY STATEMENT v.3 14 JUNE 2024).

Reason: To ensure that the development complies with Policy SI2 of the London Plan (2021) and to ensure that the development is in line with the original agreements secured by the s106 for 174485FUL/ 195092VAR/ 234742VAR.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas shall be enhanced by at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, eg. for bedrooms above/below/adjoining kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom/ circulation space of separate dwelling. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan.

| Prior to occupation of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 10/15dB, as necessary, above the Building Regulations value for residential use, of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial  premises and communal areas and facilities from dwellings, and not exceeding a Noise Rating level of NR20 Leq 5mins inside bedrooms. Details shall include the installation method and materials of separating structures and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound level. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan.
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the occupation of the development, all of the proposals set out in the LANDSCAPE ADDENDUM dated JUNE 2024 shall be implemented in full. This includes but is not limited to, the dining areas, multi-purpose seating and planters, artwork, and paving patterns to demarcate areas of different functions. The layout and design of the landscaping shall be laid out in line with the information on pages 5 and 6 of the addendum.
Reason: To ensure that the development has a functional design to facilitate social interaction and inclusion in compliance with Policy D5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The additional 10 student rooms and additional floor space hereby approved shall be provided with the same fresh air ventilation system as the existing development approved under ref. 242530CND. This system shall be retained throughout the lifetime of the development unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of future occupiers in accordance with the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development Core Strategy 2026 (2012) and the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
description: Single storey ground floor extension and extension of mezzanine floor to the existing student accommodation/commercial building (Mixed Use Class Sui Generis/E); installation of a new glass pyramid skylights to courtyard areas; landscaping alterations; additional cycle storage
